Recipes.name: Abak atama
Recipes.description: Abak Atama Soup is a delicious soup popular amongst the Ibibios of Akwa Ibom State in Southern Nigeria. Its name is derived from the two dominant ingredients: Palm Fruit Concentrate (Abak) and Atama Leaves.

Recipes.name: Ora Soup
Recipes.description: Ora (Oha) soup is native to the South Eastern Nigeria. It is a very traditional soup similar to the bitterleaf soup but cooked with Ora leaves.

Recipes.name: Efo Riro
Recipes.description: Efo Riro is a rich vegetable soup that is native to the Yorubas of Western Nigeria. The vegetables that can be used to cook this soup are Efo Shoko or Efo Tete (Green Amaranth).

Recipes.name: Ekpang Nkwukwo
Recipes.description: Ekpang Nkwukwo is one of the Nigerian cocoyam recipes made with grated cocoyam, water yam, cocoyam leaves and periwinkle. It is a Nigerian food recipe native to the South South Eastern Nigeria, the Cross River and Akwa Ibom States of Nigeria.

Recipes.name: Edikang Ikong
Recipes.description: The Nigerian Edikang Ikong soup or simply Vegetable Soup is native to the Efiks, people from Akwa Ibom and Cross River states of Nigeria. It is a general notion that the Edikang Ikong soup is very nutritious and this is very much so. Prepared with a generous quantity of pumpkin leaves and water leaves, this Nigerian soup recipe is nourishing in every sense of the word.

Recipes.name: Achicha Ede
Recipes.description: Achicha Ede (Echicha Ede in Enugu State of Nigeria) is a cocoyam pottage prepared with dried cocoyam flakes. It is one of the most traditional meals in Igboland.

Recipes.name: Gizdodo
Recipes.description: Gizdodo is the perfect way to combine a few farm fresh ingredients with great results. You can't believe the number of ingredients in this single meal. Yummy!.

Recipes.name: Coconut Jollof Rice
Recipes.description: If you want to surprise someone, this meal I call the surprise Jollof Rice should be your first choice. Your guests think they are about to eat the classic Jollof Rice but are pleasantly surprised when the meal hits the tongue!

Recipes.name: Coconut Spaghetti Jollof
Recipes.description: It's time to take your Spaghetti Jollof Rice from basic to exotic!.

Recipes.name: Nigerian Fried Rice
Recipes.description: This is a recipe for the easiest Fried Rice you will ever cook and it is so tasty.

Recipes.name: Jollof Stuffed Chicken
Recipes.description: This recipe is simply the classic Jollof Rice cooked inside the belly of whole chicken. It's a different way to serve Jollof Rice

Recipes.name: African Salad (Abacha)
Recipes.description: Abacha is prepared with cassava. The cassava tubers are cooked till done then sliced with a special grater. Your African Salad will not be complete without Ugba. Ugba, also known as Ukpaka, is made from oil bean seeds.

Recipes.name: Chicken Suya Salad
Recipes.description: Chicken Suya Salad is simply the yummy medemede of Chicken Suya with all the vegetables that go well with suya, in one plate.

Recipes.name: Birdâ€™s Nest Salad
Recipes.description: If you want to serve salads with a gourmet wow factor, then you should try this. I can't guarantee that it is easy to tuck those long strands of lettuce and carrots into your mouth but you can see that it is easy on the eye. It's one of those plating techniques that is worth trying at least once in your life just so that you can feel a sense of achievement..

Recipes.name: Mixed Vegetables Curry Sauce
Recipes.description: The go-to vegetable sauce. It's quick, it's easy and it's delicious! It's the perfect match for boiled white rice. Take a break from fried tomato stew and try the Mixed Vegetables Curry Sauce today.

Recipes.name: Garden Egg Sauce
Recipes.description: Garden Egg Sauce may well be the best sauce for Boiled White Yam. It contains palm oil which boiled yam loves.

Recipes.name: Spicy Durban chicken curry
Recipes.description: From the east coast of South Africa comes this vibrant chicken curry. Not for the faint-hearted!

Recipes.name: Bunny chow (chicken curry rolls)
Recipes.description: South African bunny chow which comprises curry in a hollowed out bread loaf, is a budget-friendly meal loved for its portability and rich, hearty flavours.

Recipes.name: Bobotie (South African curried mince pie)
Recipes.description: This traditional South African dish incorporates mildly spiced curried mince with a savoury custard topping.

Recipes.name: Cauliflower Stir-fry
Recipes.description: Cauliflower Stir-fry makes a great side dish to Grilled Chicken, Nigerian rice dishes, Fried Plantain and Nigerian Moi Moi. It is also a nice light meal on its own.
